required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Collaborative-care Rehabilitation to Improve Functional Outcomes After Dysvascular Amputation

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to examine the feasibility of using a collaborative-care, home-based rehabilitation program to improve functional outcomes for people recovering from lower limb amputation caused by vascular problems and/or diabetes complications. The primary hypothesis is that the rehabilitation program will result in greater improvements in performance-based and participant-reported measures of physical function, compared to standard of care after outpatient rehabilitation.

primary_outcome.description: Performance-based physical function test able to predict falls for people with lower limb amputation. The TUG test time is taken from rising from a chair, walking 3 meters, turning, walking back and sitting down. Continuous scale; higher time indicates lower physical function, higher likelihood of falls.

secondary_outcome.description: Performance-based physical function test measures total number of meters walked in two minutes on a level walkway.
Performance-based physical function test measures the time to walk 5 meters at the participant's "normal, everyday pace".

Self-report physical function questionnaire measures capacity to perform a list of specific functional tasks (e.g., walking upstairs, getting in and out of a vehicle. Scores range from being unable or hardly able (0) to having no problems (4). An average score across the 12-item questionnaire was used in the analysis. Lower numbers indicate less difficulty.
Self-report physical function questionnaire. The outcome is the sum of scores from each item (min 0, max 12). A higher score indicates higher self-report of physical function with the prosthesis.

Self-report physical function questionnaire. The outcome is the average score for up to five participant-identified activities on a scale from 0-10 (min 0, max 10). Higher score indicates greater ability to perform functional activities.
Instrumented physical activity measure, average step counts per day

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-Efficacy in Managing Chronic Disease Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Scale range is 1-10. The score for the scale is the mean of the six items, using a ten point scale. Higher number indicates higher self-efficacy.

secondary_outcome.measure: World Health Organization Disability Assessment Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Scores ranging from 1 (no difficulty) to 5 (extreme difficulty/cannot do). Overall disability was calculated by summing the scores for the 12 items; higher scores indicated greater disability (score range: 12-60).

arm_group.description: Exercise, Walking Program, and Health Self-Management Support. Participants will be visited at home once monthly and contacted by phone once weekly over 12 weeks to deliver the interventions.
No intervention will be applied. Participants will be visited at home once monthly and contacted by phone once weekly over 12 weeks to monitor health status.

intervention.description: Exercise will target muscle strength and joint mobility impairments and will be delivered over a 12 week period.
A walking program will be established with the goal of participants walking at least five days per week. Duration of program is 12 weeks.
Health self-management support will be delivered with weekly meetings between the researcher and participant over a 12-week period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Diabetes and/or Peripheral Artery Disease
2. Unilateral transtibial amputation < 6 months prior to screening
3. Household ambulation using definitive prosthesis prior to baseline testing
4. Participation in physical rehabilitation at time of baseline testing
5. Live within 45 minutes of a participating clinic
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Require wheelchair for mobility (use prosthesis for transfers only)
2. Ankle-level or above amputation on contralateral limb
3. Traumatic or cancer-related amputation
4. Uncontrolled heart condition
5. Acute systemic infection
6. Pregnancy
7. Decisionally challenged
8. Prisoners

facility.name: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: No significant study events occurred after participants were enrolled, but before they were assigned to a study group.

group.title: Exercise, Activity, and Self-management
group.description: Exercise, Walking Program, and Health Self-Management Support. Participants will be visited at home once monthly and contacted by phone once weekly over 12 weeks to deliver the interventions. Exercise: Exercise will target muscle strength and joint mobility impairments and will be delivered over a 12 week period. Walking Program: A walking program will be established with the goal of participants walking at least five days per week. Duration of program is 12 weeks. Health Self-Management Support: Health self-management support will be delivered with weekly meetings between the researcher and participant over a 12-week period.

group.description: No intervention will be applied. Participants will be visited at home once monthly and contacted by phone once weekly over 12 weeks to monitor health status.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Site of Rehab, n, Veterans Administration Medical Center
measure.description: Number of participants treated at Veterans Administration Medical Center

measure.title: Geriatric Depression Scale, score out of 15
measure.description: Scale range is 0-15. Score is total out of possible maximum of 15. A score of 0 to 5 is normal. A score greater than 5 suggests referral for assessment of depression.

measure.title: Mini Mental Status Exam, score out of 30
measure.description: The maximum score is 30 points. Score of 20 to 24 suggests mild dementia, 13 to 20 suggests moderate dementia, and less than 12 indicates severe dementia.

measure.title: Intrinsic Motivation Inventory, score out of 7
measure.description: The mean of the 7 items is the summary score for the Intrinsic Motivation – Interest and Enjoyment Subscale (Min possible 1, Max possible 7). Higher number indicates higher interest/enjoyment.

measure.title: Chakrabarty Grade, score out of 100
measure.description: The sum of all items is the score (Min possible -104, Max possible 100). Higher score indicates more favorable residual limb health.

measure.title: Comorbidity Index, score out of 20
measure.description: The comorbidity index is a sum of 18 comorbidities (Min possible 0, Max possible 18). Higher score indicates higher comorbidity.

outcome.title: Timed Up-and-Go Test
outcome.description: Performance-based physical function test able to predict falls for people with lower limb amputation. The TUG test time is taken from rising from a chair, walking 3 meters, turning, walking back and sitting down. Continuous scale; higher time indicates lower physical function, higher likelihood of falls.
outcome.population: 38 (35 men, 3 women; 19 INT, 19 CTL) enrolled. 1 INT and 1 CTL lost to follow-up. 36 participants assessed at all time points. Two CTL at 12 weeks and 2 CTL,1 INT at 24 weeks completed questionnaires only.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Small sample size limited statistical power to identify group differences in secondary outcomes. CTL group exercise behavior only tracked step count. No direct measurement of intervention fidelity.

point_of_contact.organization: University of Colorado Denver, Anschutz Medical Campus
